result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane Allen Goossens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: LiddleADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Shane Allen Goossens appeared. Case called at 4:10 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a pre trial conference. Atty Andrea states there is a resolution. Recites agreement. Will argue sentence. Defense stipulates to the amount of restitution. Believes DE is competent and understands. On medication currently. NGI and Competency are withdrawn. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 Retail Theft-Intentionally Take in 15CM160 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Retail Theft-Intentionally Take in 15CM160. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses and reads in for restitution purposes Ct's 2-10 in 15CM160. Court is satisfied that the DE is competent and understands the plea today. Sentencing arguments. State has complied with Victims Rights. 20 days to file appeal. 

Crt orders:

- Impose 16 days jail. 16 days credit. TIME SERVED.

- Court costs of $243.00. Reduce to civil judgment

- Restitution in the amount of $224.09. Reduce to civil judgment
Pre-trial conference on November 7, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Filed by ADA McKinley. Re: Hearing on 7/15/2016 and requesting a SIBS. km

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,           Mills Fleet Farm.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. Atty Alex Andrea present. DE Shane Goossens does not appear. ADA McKinley present. Case called at 1:53 p.m. Parties are currently in courtroom for intake. Court notes the ME file regarding the DE has been dismissed. DE is currently in Winnbago and a cash bond is in place. ADA McKinley has no argument in regards to bond. Atty Andrea gives argument. Proposal is if restitution is ordered on this matter it be converted to a civil judgment. Maintains NGI plea. Court will modify bond to a signature bond, 07-15-2016 PTC to stay on the calendar and DE to sign at the courtdate. If DE does not appear, matter will be reset.
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.
